tds

Class Task

  • java.lang.Object
    • tds.Task
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Comparable<Task>

    public class Task
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Comparable<Task>
    A task object used to store task name, time and different attributes.
    Author:
    amoshydra

    • Field Detail

      • DATE_NULL

        public static final int DATE_NULL
        Field value for start time or end time attribute indicating an empty date.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Constructor Detail

      • Task

        public Task(java.lang.String name,
            long startTime,
            long endTime,
            Task.FLAG_TYPE flag,
            Task.PRIORITY_TYPE priority)
        Initializes a newly created Task object so that it store the name, starting time, ending time, flag and priority as the argument. An internal ID will be used to differentiate duplicated value.
        Parameters:
        name - the name or description of the newly constructed Task
        startTime - the starting time of the newly constructed Task in UNIX format
        endTime - the ending time of the newly constructed Task in UNIX format
        flag - the given flag field; Task marked as done is specified with this flag.
        priority - the given priority field;

      • Task

        public Task(int id,
            java.lang.String name,
            long startTime,
            long endTime,
            Task.FLAG_TYPE flag,
            Task.PRIORITY_TYPE priority)
        Initializes a newly created Task object so that it store the name, starting time, ending time, flag and priority as the argument. The ID will be specified through fileProcessor only. Do not use this to add new task from user.
        Parameters:
        id - the index number used to identify this task.
        name - the name or description of the newly constructed Task
        startTime - the starting time of the newly constructed Task in UNIX format
        endTime - the ending time of the newly constructed Task in UNIX format
        flag - the given flag field; Task marked as done is specified with this flag.
        priority - the given priority field;

      • Task

        public Task(java.lang.String name)
        Initializes a newly created Task object which contain only the name or description of the task. The value of starting time, ending time and flag are set to null or zero. Priority will be initialized to normal.
        Parameters:
        name - the name or description of the newly constructed Task

      • equals

        public boolean equals(java.lang.Object obj)
        Determines whether or not two task are equal. The two tasks are equal if the values name, start time, end time, flag and priority are equal.
        Overrides:
        equals in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        true if the object to be compared is an instance of Task and has the same attributes; false otherwise.

      • compareTo

        public int compareTo(Task rhs)
        Compares this Task instance with another based on the order they are created.
        Specified by:
        compareTo in interface java.lang.Comparable<Task>
        Returns:
        the value 0 if this Task is equal to the argument Task; a value less than 0 if this Task is created earlier than the argument Task; and a value greater than 0 if this Task is created later than the argument Task.

      • getAttributesDiff

        public boolean[] getAttributesDiff(Task rhs)
        Compares this Task instance with another to generate an array of check bits.
        Parameters:
        rhs - a Task to be compared with this Task
        Returns:
        a boolean array with all element as true if the Task is identical to the other; A difference in attributes between two task will cause a boolean in the array to become false.

        public int compareNameTo(Task rhs)

        the value 0 if the name of this Task is equal to the argument Task; a value less than 0 if this name is lexicographically less than the argument name; a value greater than 0 if this name is lexicographically greater than the argument name.
